Defines

#define DEFAULT_SICK_IP_ADDRESS   "192.168.1.10"
 Default Sick LD Inet 4 address.
#define DEFAULT_SICK_TCP_PORT   (49152)
 Default TCP port.
#define DEFAULT_SICK_MESSAGE_TIMEOUT   (5.0)
 Maximum number of seconds allowed between bytes before calling a timeout (NOTE: This value must be at least 4 seconds as switching modes can cause the Sick to take up to 4 secs to reply!).
#define DEFAULT_SICK_NUM_SCAN_PROFILES   (0)
 Setting this value to 0 will tell the Sick LD to stream measurements when measurement data is requested (NOTE: A profile is a single scans worth of range measurements).
#define DEFAULT_SICK_SIGNAL_SET   (0)
 Default Sick signal configuration.
#define SICK_DEGREES_PER_MOTOR_STEP   (0.0625)
 Each odometer tick is equivalent to rotating the scan head this many degrees.
#define SICK_NUM_TICKS_PER_MOTOR_REV   (5760)
 Odometer ticks per revolution of the Sick LD scan head.
#define SICK_MAX_MEAN_PULSE_FREQUENCY   (10800)
 Max mean pulse frequence of the current device configuration (in Hz) (see page 22 of the operator's manual).
#define SICK_MAX_PULSE_FREQUENCY   (14400)
 Max pulse frequency of the device (in Hz) (see page 22 of the operator's manual).
#define SICK_MAX_SCAN_AREA   (360)
 Maximum area that can be covered in a single scan (deg).
#define SICK_MAX_SCAN_ANGULAR_RESOLUTION   (0.125)
 Minimum valid separation between laser pulses in active scan ares (deg).
#define SICK_MIN_MOTOR_SPEED   (5)
 Minimum motor speed in Hz.
#define SICK_MAX_MOTOR_SPEED   (20)
 Maximum motor speed in Hz.
#define SICK_MIN_VALID_SENSOR_ID   (1)
 The lowest value the Sick will accept as a Sensor ID.
#define SICK_MAX_VALID_SENSOR_ID   (254)
 The largest value the Sick will accept as a Sensor ID.
#define SICK_MAX_NUM_MEASUREMENTS_PER_SECTOR   (2161)
 Maximum number of measurements per sector (based on the limits given on page 59 of the telegram listing).
#define SICK_MAX_NUM_SECTORS   (8)
 Maximum number of scan sectors (NOTE: This value must be even).
#define DATA_UNKNOWN_STRING   "UNKNOWN"
 Default string for value for relevant string members.
#define SWAP_VALUES(x, y, t)   (t=x,x=y,y=t);
 A simple macro for swapping two values.

Detailed Description

Defines the SickLD class for working with the Sick LD-OEM/LD-LRS long range units.

Code by Jason Derenick at Lehigh University. Contact at derenick(at)lehigh(dot)edu
